alert.note: Alert for Bitterroot, Sapphire Mountains; Lower Clark Fork Region; Missoula, Bitterroot Valleys; Potomac, Seeley Lake Region (Montana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Missoula (Western Montana and Central Idaho)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued November 27 at 1:41PM MST by NWS Missoula
info.description: ...An intense snow shower will impact portions of south central Missoula County through 230 PM MST... At 140 PM MST, Doppler radar was tracking an intense snow shower over Missoula, moving east at 25 mph. HAZARD...Visibility one-half mile or less and winds in excess of 30 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Low visibility could result in dangerous driving conditions. Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Missoula, Lolo, Bonner-West Riverside, Wye, East Missoula, Frenchtown, Evaro and Turah. This includes the following highways... Interstate 90 near mile marker 81, and between mile markers 85 and 115. Highway 93 N between mile markers 0 and 8. Highway 93 S between mile markers 83 and 94. Highway 200 E between mile markers 0 and 5. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: This storm may intensify, so be certain to monitor local radio stations and available television stations for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service.

area.areaDesc: Bitterroot, Sapphire Mountains; Lower Clark Fork Region; Missoula, Bitterroot Valleys; Potomac, Seeley Lake Region
